title: Firefox for Android 41.0 Release

notes.note: Quickly search with different search providers from the search panel
Swipe-to-close tabs on tablets
Overlay to manually search and copy/paste login credentials from login manager when they're not auto-filled
Improved bookmark management with duplicate bookmark detection
Improved box-shadow rendering performance
Open Android applications from a web page via [Intent URIs](https://developer.chrome.com/multidevice/android/intents)
Locale added: Croatian (hr)
Updates to image decoding process

Support for running [animations][1] of 'transform' and 'opacity' on the compositor thread


  [1]: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/GFX/OffMainThreadCompositing#CSS_Animations

[User Agent][1] now includes Android version

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Gecko_user_agent_string_reference#Android_%28version_41_and_above%29

[MessageChannel][1] and [MessagePort][2] API enabled by default

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessageChannel
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/MessagePort

Added support for the [transform-origin][1] property on SVG elements

[1]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin

Copy/Cut Web content from JavaScript to the OS clipboard with [document.execCommand("cut"/"copy")][1]

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Document/execCommand

[CSS Font Loading API][1] enabled by default

[1]: http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-font-loading/
Removed support for binary XPCOM components in extensions, use addon SDK "system/child_process" pipe mechanism for native binaries instead

[JavaAddonManager][1] can now send, receive and respond to messages from Gecko

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/Add-ons/Firefox_for_Android/API/JavaAddonManager.jsm

Experimental new "speed dial" home panel add-on API ([example add-on][1])

[1]: https://github.com/pocmo/speed-dial

Generic API let's developers create a [grid of icons][1] and then optionally allow for a large header image


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/Firefox_for_Android/Firefox_Hub_Walkthrough#View_types
Support for playing MP3 files on Android 5.0 (Lollipop) and above

Various [security fixes][1]

 [1]:https://www.mozilla.org/security/known-vulnerabilities/firefox/#firefox41

text: We'd also like to extend a special thank you to all of the new Mozillians who contributed to this release of Firefox!
